BACK TO KERRY AND THE HUNK
ON THE GIRLS IN THE NEXT FIELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big, yellow SCHOOL BUS pulls up to a corner and dischar group of TEENAGERS.  It's one of those fantastic spring a and the kids take to their freedom like they were just sp Leavenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, Joe...Have a good weekend, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUS DRIVER doesn't answer but nods and smiles as they He is a pleasant looking elderly man, wearing a khaki wor a matching cap and chewing on an unlit, twenty-five cent The DOORS fold shut, the GEARS GRIND and the bus continue its route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While there are only about a dozen kids on the bus, the n level is deafening.  GIRLS are yapping, GUYS are horsing someone is fiddling with a ghetto-blaster, trying to deci several loud stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus turns a corner, taking them out of the developmen past some older, less identical looking residences spaced widely apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver downshifts the old heap, pulls the wheel over curb and reaches over to push the door lever open. KIDS file out down he aisle, some of them wishing him wel leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the gears grind again and the bus pulls away.  We see there are only a few KIDS remaining:  TWO GIRLS sit toget toward the center and a lone, nerdy-looking BOY sits at t The DRIVER is in front of an aluminum divider and, except top of his cap, cannot be seen.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE THREE KIDS
dialogues.text: The two girls are pretty, teen-fashionable and just a lit immature.  One of them turns back to look over her should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor kid.  About 17, four-eyes, bad skin, lousy posture a obvious inferiority complex.  He's sweating profussely an stands slightly to unlatch and lower the window.  He pull it with all his strength but it is hopelessly stuck. He sits back down and sighs.  Suddenly, he feels the girl he doesn't turn but sends his eyes over to see who's gogg him.

dialogues.speaker: ON GIRLS
dialogues.text: The first girl turns back to her friend to whisper someth friend turns around to see for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stares forward now and catches her glance directl The girls shift quickly in their seats to face forard and with an uncontrollable rush of mean giggles. The boy is clearly embarrassed now and looks down at the his lap. We hear the engine REVVING - the bus seems to be picking One of the girls stands, ready to get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER, her PRE-SCHOOL CHILD on a TRICYCLE and their DO for the bus to discharge the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus speeds past the waiting group, to their amazement

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The standind girl's jaw drops open as they shoot by a fam looking intersection and continue to pick up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to her friend) Hey! (calling to driver) Hey, that war our stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus turns a sharp corner and the first girl almost fa second girl grips onto the seatback and lifts herself to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to the driver) Hey, Joe!  Our stop!

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT OF THE BUS
dialogues.text: The unseen driver ignores the calls and continues picking speed.  We might notice that his hat has changed; in plac cap, we can see the top of a BATTERED OLD FEDORA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let us off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky has suddenly turned; a wave of threatening clouds overhead and the WIND is churning a planting of roadside willows into a tangled mess of yellow tendrils. The bus WHINES near the top end of third, all of its FLAS going like the dashboard was having a major coronary.  It the last house and heads into open terrain.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BUS
dialogues.text: THE SECOND GIRL steps into the aisle and starts making he toward the front of the coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Deaf old fart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops suddenly and GASPS as she watches

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER'S ARM
dialogues.text: emerge to throw the floorshift into fourth.  His hand is strange GLOVE that tip his fingers with a menacing set of SHARP, STEEL TALONS.  His sleeve is charred and smoking. The bus SWERVES WILDLY as it skids around a corner, throw few passengers into collision courses with the walls and other. A FLASH OF LIGHTNING crashes through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the lightning subsides, the sky is dark.  The BUS SCRE along, banging through rocks and ditches, CRASHING throug of overgrown brambles.  Thick clouds of steam pour out fr he hood and stream back along toward the rear of the vehi

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOY
dialogues.text: holding o to his seatback and watching out the window in trees TEAR loose from the ground i the bus'wake. We hear a LOUD RUMBLING and the bus begins to shake as if planet itself is splitting in two.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BUS
dialogues.text: Skidding across the desert landscape, being THROWN to and laterally, at the mercy of the shuddering landscape.

dialogues.speaker: ON A FRONT WHEEL
dialogues.text: as the tire smacks into a jagged boulder, SNAPPING the wh its axle.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FRONT END
dialogues.text: BOUNCING to a violent halt, the bumer digging a long tren the earth.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BUS
dialogues.text: THE KIDS pick themselves up from the floor.  It is very h smoky inside.  They have moved closer together now, sweat scared. Frantically, the boy tries to open a window, but not budge. He looks out the window and gasps.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: THE GROUND below begins to SPLIT apart and tumble into a fissure that is encirling the bus.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOOR, THE BUS CENTER
dialogues.text: The land is IMPLODING all around it; huge chunks of the e crust are shearing themselves loose from the edges of the and tumbling into oblivion. In moments, the bus is stranded on the narrow tip of a to ridge of crumbling stone. The bus teeters precariously, tasting the smoky abyss in direction.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: THE SECOND GIRL is on al fours in the aisle.  She looks u the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing something hideous) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles to her feet and begins backing off.  The fl the bus shifts dangerously, throwing the girl into the ed of the seats.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: as he makes his way toward the back.  We don'g see his fa is dressed in a filthy green and red sweater.  In the B.G dashboard instruments are sparking and sending thick blac toward the ceiling.  SMOKE is rising off his body as if h stepped out of some horrible fire.  A small patch of skin hand sizzles and pops and drips a molten glob of flesh th a small hole in a seat cushion. His Razor-Talons sweep along the tops of the seat-backs C deep gashes into the green vinyl upholstery and SCRAPING over the tubular steel support poles.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOY
dialogues.text: Terrified.  Lookign first at the awful talons, then out t at the DEADLY DROP and back at the bus driver.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Sweating, panicking.  They back away, going from window t trying desperately to pull them down.  They're all locked One reaches for the emergence door leer at the rear of th It comes off in her hand. The kids huddle together, petrified, screaming, as the dr upon her.

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: He lifts the awful, talonned glove in f.g.  Behind, obscu smoke, we see, for an instant, his fce -- the face of FRE raises his weapon arm higher and STRIKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a steel blade cutting into red flesh.  We PULL B see that it is MOM, slicing a tomato at the kitchen count This is an all-American family; along with a MOM, there's and a kid sister named NGELA and they ll are having break together. A moment later, there is a muffled, OFF-CAMERA SCREAM.  M up.  We can also make out the RINGING of an alarm clock i part of the house. ANGELA jumps slightly at the scream.  She's a pretty litt eleven-year old, genuinely cute, not precocious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mom) Why can't Jesse wake up like every- body else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) Shhh.  He must've had another night- mare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JESSE'S BED. An alarm clock RINGS LOUDLY. JESSE WALSH (17) is sitting up in bed.  He's sweaty and s disoriented as he slams his hand down on the alarm and tr shake the nightmare out of his head. We see that he's the boy on the bus only he's not half-ba - far from nerdy.  he has no skin problems and he doesn't glasses and his body's in good shape. As he gets out of bed, still shaky from the dream, and we his bedroom is littered with cardboard cartons - most of and half-empty.  He trips over a carton on his way to his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom is at the stove cooking eggs for her family.  She loo worried, as Jesse comes in and heads for the refrigerator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbles) 'Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on a smile) 'Morning, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pours himself a GLASS OF MILK from the fridge.  He and Angela family at the breakfast table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got your room straightened out yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawns) It's getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only been living here six weeks now.  I want that room unpacked by tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM comes over with some eggs for Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) Want some eggs...Angela, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: She is struggling to put her hand deep into a box of FU-M breakfast cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I'm trying to get the Fu-Man Fingers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Printed on the box is a cartoon caricature of the Orienta pointing to a bowl of his product with one of his long, s fingernails.  there's a burst above the product name that "FREE INSIDE - FU-MAN FINGERS" and shows a drawing of a h wearing several extra-long, red plastic fingernails on it fingertips. Mom lets Angela go o with her search and turns back to Je waiting for his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse rubs his temples.  He was away for a minute but he' now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...uh, no, just some milk, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad eyes him suspicously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine.  Just really hot  upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I know it's warm... (to Dad) I wish you'd call someone to check out the air conditioning, Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) I know what's wrong with the air coditioning - just needs a shot of  freon, is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad's fixin' something again.  Hit the deck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short silence as they all look back to their plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) So, school going alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Okay, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is looking around for some escape - this interrogat getting a little too personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know how it is...

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: She grabs onto the prize at the botto of the box and give A bagful of Fu Man Fingers come out in her hand along wit the box of cereal.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND OVER
dialogues.text: Mom turns to answer the door, but Jesse immediately jumps cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Lisa - I gotta get to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Who's Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jesse is gone; just a kitchen door, swinging in his w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as JESSE opens the front door to LISA POLETTI (17).  She the street and she turns around when she hears the door o a knock-out but real pretty, with an intelligence and swe about her -- she is truly lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and Jesse's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to JESSE'S CAR - a beat-up, blue Falcon parked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gratefully) your timing was perfect - I was  getting the third degree in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse opens Lisa's car door for her.  She steps in and si

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: The interior is worse than the body.  The upholstery is t shreds, the dashboard is cracked and peeling and there's hole where the radio used to be.  A cheap, A.M. transisto hangs by its wrist strap from the rear-view mirror. Jesse hops in and shifts around to get comfortable, and r under the dash to pull out a couple of bare wires. Lisa watches him routinely twist the wires together, amus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you afraid somebody could steal your car like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preposterously) Look at this car.  Are you kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up again and reaches for a toggle switch that has crudely drilled into the dash.  He flicks the switch. Jesse moves his finger to another alien button in the das pushes it.  The STARTER turns over slowly, the engine BAC and the car starts noisily. Jesse gives her the "thumbs up" as if he were a World War and puts the car into gear.  It BUCKS and FARTS and rumbl street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD floats on a FOAM CHAIR in the middle of the rather ru pool, sipping coffee from a MUG bearing the word "DAD". over his domain with satisfaction and inhales a deep brea fresh, suburban sir. MOM comes out the back door.  She looks just a bit worrie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, shouldn't you be getting to the office?  It's almost nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as i finish my coffee.  I'm enjoying my pool right now. (sips his coffee) I love our new house.  Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs heavily) Of course I do, Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Shirl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing behind her) It's just I'll be a lot happier when  you finish taking down those bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS UP AND ZOOMS IN to reveal BARS ON THE UPPER W this is the old Thompson house, replete with the security paraphernalia that kept Nancy Thompson prisoner five year

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People that lived here before must have been truly paranoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of school, shot from parking lot with J CAR in f.g.  School is in session, so the only students w TWO CLASS-CUTTERS leaning against a car passing a JOINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intramural SOFTBALL GAME is in progress.  COACH SCHNEI nasty looking ex-Marine, stands behind home plate as an u JESSE is covering second base. RONNY GRADY, a tough-looking wise-ass type, steps up to t He knocks the mud off his sneakers with his bat and takes stance.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: He glances over to the adjacent field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS are in the middle of archery instruction. LISA is there, mighty tempting looking in her little, pow gym suit, a quiver strapped to her shoulder and a longbow hand. KERRY, a dizzy, Bloomingdale's-punk, steps up alongside L the latter catches Jesse's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa, re Jesse) He made any moves yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smiles and waves to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside to Kerry) I only know him a few weeks, Kerry.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: He waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he needs a push start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns to face the target, slides an arrow into the n point, draws back the bowstring and lets the arrow go.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TARGET
dialogues.text: It's a bull's-eye.

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: GRADY gets hold of a perfect pitch and sends it flying ov head of the PITCHER.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The ball skids off the side of his head and the kid colla HIS TEAMMATES rush to his side and help Jesse to his feet more embarrassed than hurt and he waves away any over-att COACH SHNEIDER joins the circle of bodies around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) Well, pay attention, next time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse re-takes his position on the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you oughta try something a little more your speed, Walsh.  Like knitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse just now realizes that it was Grady who scored a do his skull.  He's standing just off the bag, harassing Jes waiting to be hit home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping him the bird) Knit this, Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRADY sneers and gives him the "JACK-OFF" sign. JESSE tosses an "ITALIAN SALUTE", slapping one hand into of his arm and throwing up "THE FINGER" for good measure. GRADY grabs his own crotch and points to it obscenely.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PITCHER
dialogues.text: He sends one over the plate, the BATTER catches it dead-c POUNDS it back to left field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRADY makes a break for third, only to be forced back by FIELDER tossing the ball to the THIRD BASEMAN.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: His glove up to receive the throw as Grady STEAMS towards The ball snaps into Jesse's mitt and Grady turns on his a shoot back to third. Jesse and the third baseman toss the ball between, each t moving closer in toward Grady.  Grady switches directions ball, trapped between them. GRADY dives into a HEAD-FIRST SLIDE, trying to sneak past JESSE swoops down and tags him out. Thorougly aggravated, Grady rises to his feet by reaching grabbing onto Jesse's gym shorts and yanking them down to ankles, revealing jesse's bare buns-in-a-jockstrap to the JESSE lunges for Grady, trips over his shorts and the two begin rolling around in the dirt, duking it out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GIRLS IN THE NEXT FIELD
dialogues.text: watching the wrestling match with ausement.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA AND KERRY
dialogues.text: Lisa tries like hell to repress some laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut ass.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCNEIDER
dialogues.text: pushing his way through a crowd of laughing, cheering SPE and jumping in to break up the scuffle. He lifts both boys up by their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay boys, assume the position!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider is at his desk.  TWO BOYS carrying gym bags pas the Coach's office.  They wave to him through the WIRE-GL WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night Coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider gives them a cold glance. He checks his watch, gets up and goes to a window to look

dialogues.speaker: THE PRACTICE FIELD
dialogues.text: JESSE and GRADY, side by side in the center of the baseba diamond.  They are in "front-leaning rest" position, the painful frozen pushup that ends halfway to the ground wit bent. We don't know how long they've been out there but it's pr hours.  It seems just a little darker out and a lonely wi blowing around their arms and legs. In the B.G., KIDS are filing out of the building - some s look out at the two boys, point and snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see LISA among the kids.  She stops for a moment and v scene with concern.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE AND GRADY
dialogues.text: They are dirty, their shirts are ripped and Jesse has a t bruise over his cheek. And they're tired too.  The muscles in their arms are twi convulsively and they talk to each other between groans a through teeth clenched with pain. We hear the OFF-CAMERA SOUND of several busses pulling ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer you figure he'll keep us out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be all night. (nodding in the Coach's direction) Guy gets his rocks off like this. Hangs out in queer S & M joints downtown.  Likes prettyboys like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady doesn't pursue it.  Instead, he looks around and tr think of some small-talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) So, what about you and that Poletti girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two got a thing going, or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a neighbor, I drive her to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She giving you any carfare for the  ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem with me, Grady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Naw. Just killing time.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE COACH
dialogues.text: Dressed in his street clothes, crossing the field toward faculty parking lot.  He pulls the whistle from his mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boys) Okay boys, hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE and GRADY stand at opposite ends of a row of locker change into their street clothes.  Their movements are sl cumbersome - like a pair of creaky old men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) So, you live around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs wearily) Not too far.  My folks bought a place over on Elm Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady stops buttoning his shirt and looks up at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elm Street?  You telling me you moved in to that big white house with the bars on the windows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady shakes his head and tucks his shirtails in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, you can tell your old man he's  a real chump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've only been trying to unload  that dump for five years.  That  place is bad news.  Some chick was locked in there by her mother and she went crazy.  She watched her  boyfriend get butchered by some  maniac in the house across the street.   Her poor drunken momma took her own life right inside your front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stares dubiously at Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous laugh) You're full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pulls his knapsack from the locker shelf, slams the shut and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: ON GRADY
dialogues.text: He smiles mischievously and shuts his own locker door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE'S CAR is parked among a handful of others.  LISA le against the front fender, waithing patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE steps out of the building and spots her.  he hurrie the lot.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: as Jesse approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised to see her) Hi!  You didn't have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises an eyebrow as he opens the door for her.  He li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jesse slides in beside her and STARTS the engine. She looks him over.  He looks like he's been through the couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me look at your eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse lifts his chin to show off the tiny bruise over his cheekbone.  He looks almost a little proud of it - like i old war wound.  Lisa touches it tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be fighting with that jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Grady?  Grady's alright, he's  just a hothead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a shithead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He guns the engine and they pull away.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: It's very late.  The house is dark and even the crickets the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE's having trouble sleeping.  He turns over on differ and punches up his pillow a couple of times, stares into finally sits up. He gets out of bed, pulls on a pair of pants and exits.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: He enters.  The room is lit only by the glow of a three q moon. He regains his composure and steps over to the sink to pu absurd length of paper toweling. We see it just when Jesse does;  a GROTESQUE FACE has bee into the window all this time.  It disappears from view o DOUBLE TAKE. Jesse stops for a moment to slow down his heart.  He take breath and steps up to the back door. He opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse opens the gate and enters.  It is really quiet; not night-sounds. He strains to see past the shrubbery that surrounds the h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse whisper) Grady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It better be you, you son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear an awful sound from somewhere - WOOD RIPPIGNG. Jesse makes his way cautiously along the side of the hous He notices a red-orange LIGHT is flickering from behind a window.  He gets down on his hands and knees to investiga

dialogues.speaker: THE CELLAR
dialogues.text: An INTRUDER is bent over by the furnace, lit only by a ra in the fire-box.  He puts his hand right into the flames begins digging for something way in the back of the furna can't see his face but he is dressed in a filthy green an striped sweater and a battered hat. He pulls out a bundle of rags, sets it on top of the furn proceeds to unwrap it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (petrified) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up and looks around frantically.  He doesn't kn to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries out the gate that leads to the front of the ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse enters the house and scans the foyer.  He heads tow cellar door.  It is ajar -- the LOCKHAS BEEN SPLINTERED A HUGE WRECKING BAR -- and we can hear the ROAR of the furn below. He sticks his head inside the cellar door and peeks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHADOW OF A FIGURE; movement on the cellar walls.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: Breathing heavily.  Brain whirring.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM
dialogues.text: He pulls the basement door closed and holds it shut tight practically hyper-ventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something inside starts to pull the cellar door open.  Je to hold it shut, but the inexorable force continues to in open. Jesse lets go and bolts toward the foyer.  FREDDY is stan his path, a sick smile on his scarred face.  He flashes h knives at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinisterly) Daddy can't help you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tries to make a break for it but Freddy is too fast un-taloned hand gets an iron grip on Jesse's shirt collar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been waiting five years for you, Jesse.  We got special work to do, you and me.  Things are really gonna heat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse struggles to get free.  Freddy tightens his iron gr fans his talons threateningly.  Jesse's head stretches ba the chocking pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do real good together, you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy hurls Jesse against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the body... (doffs his hat) I got the brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Freddy removes his hat.  There is no skull und - just a pulsating mass of blody BRAIN MATTER. JESSE lets out an agonized SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JESSE, still in bed but his entire body arched backwar the mattress.  His scream continues until he collapses ba into the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: ON HIS DOOR
dialogues.text: It flies open and DAD crashes into the room, followed by They go to his bedside and stare at him as he pants and c way back to consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dad) Maybe we should call a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  Just a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rather bored looking group of STUDENTS is listening wit interest to the droning of their teacher, MR ABLE, who is lecturing them from the front of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, to review, the solid waste, those nutrients that are not absorbed in the lining of the stomach, the large  intestine, the small intestine - the alimentary canal - are passed out  through the colon...

dialogues.speaker: SOUND OVER
dialogues.text: LAUGHTER from the class. ABLE looks up crossly from his notes until the laughs tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) The liquid nutrients are then carried through an elaborate system of filtering, aided by the pancreas, liver and gall bladder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO GIRLS at the back of the room look at each other.  On her finger in her mouth and pretends to gag. As Able DRONES on in the B.G., we're

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: He's having a hell of a time keeping his eyes open.  His intermittently as he starts to nod out.

dialogues.speaker: ON GRADY
dialogues.text: He nudges a CLASSMATE at the next desk to look over towar They snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nodding out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or collected in the bladder to be expelled at a later time.  And this entire process is kept moving through "the circulatory system", the center of which is... (a beat) ...the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the beat, he reaches under his lab table and plunks a CALF'S HEART down right in the center of it. We hear DISGUSTED GROANS from the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Four chambers, just like the human heart, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Able describes the path by sticking his index finger into orifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the body, through the right auricle, to the right ventricle and out the  pulmonary artery to the lungs.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JESSE, ASLEEP
dialogues.text: A particularly ugly and ferocious looking SNAKE is wrappi around his arm, making its way toward Jesse's face.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: As he wakes up slowly and looks down groggily toward his

dialogues.speaker: THE SNAKE
dialogues.text: opens wide and emitsa long demonic hiss. Jesse screams and hastily begins pulling the reptile away him.

dialogues.speaker: ON ABLE
dialogues.text: Standing next to Jesse, he pulls the snake off his arm an it into a nearby tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to play with animals, Mr. Walsh, join the circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUFFAWS from the class. JESSE looks around, bewildered and embarrassed. He spots GRADY, grinning widely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortable and very suburban.  A major color T.V. takes wall opposite a pair of His and Hers Barcaloungers. DAD is watching The Six O'clock News on the tube and fann himself with a T.V. Guide. MOM sits on the couch with ANGELA, helping her with a jig puzzle. TWO PARAKEETS are fluttering around inside a cage near th into the dining room. JESSE bounces down the stairway, a rolled towel tucked un arm. DAD stares at him angrily then turns back to the game. JESSE CROSSES in front of the set on his way out of the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I told you I want that room unpacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging) Oh, come on Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pointing toward the stairway) Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's about to protest but Dad cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns around, mumbles something under his breath an back upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of glass sliders lead from the house onto a stretc patio that surrounds a gorgeous built-in swimming pool. is dotted with all the amenities of backyard recreation: bar-b-que grill, a wet-bar, plenty of pipe furniture and pair of free-standing cabanas.  The entire set-up is cont a six-foot, chain link security fence. LISA steps out of the cabana, wearing a swim suit.  She t towel onto a nearby chair and crosses to the diving board

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOARD
dialogues.text: She bounces lightly and jumps off, cutting gracefully thr water and coming up in the center of the pool. MRS. POLETTI, a pleasant looking woman in her late 40's, open the patio doors and pokes her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) There's a Jesse on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA swims to the edge of the pool and hoists herself up. throws the towel over her shoulders and picks up a wirele from a low table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, hi... (a beat, diappointed) Oh...that's okay.  Sorry you can't make it. (a beat) No, I understand.  Parents can be real pains...I'll see you in the  morning, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE stands at the foot of the bed, surveying the job un and trying to figure out where to start. Finally, he pulls a SHOE BOX from inside a larger carton, it on his desk and lifts the lid. It's full of cassette tapes.  He rifles through them, sel one and popping it inot a PORTABLE CASSETTE PLAYER on the He pushes the "play" button.  The tape is ROCK AND ROLL. The music gets him moving a bit.  He surveys the room, th to A CARTON NEAR THE BOOKSHELVES.  He reaches deep into t empty carton and pulls out a stack of books which he plop shelves next to other books already unpacked.  He tosses carton aside. He's getting into the music now as he spins around to fac bureau.  He opens a SMALL POX on the bureau while be-bopp and pulls out a PAIR OF SUNGLASSES which he puts on, prac dancing.  He dumps the contents of the box haphazardly in bureau drawer. JESSE opens a large bureau drawer.  He grbs a nearby box it into the large drawer, smoothing it over perfunctorily hands.  A Stetson cowboy hat is on top.  He drops it on h and pulls it down low over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON A FULL LENGTH MIRROR
dialogues.text: Jesse steps into frame to get a look at himself.  He like sees as he mimes a guitar riff along with the music. In one smooth move, in rhythm with the music, he seings a moves to the desk.  He dumps a SMALL BOX OF PENCILS AND S into the desk drawer.  As an afterthought, he grabs a cou pencils out of the drawer and drums a few beats on the de them. He shoves the pencils up his nostrils, tucks his thumbs u armpits and waves his elbows like he's doing the "Funky C Silly stuff that one owuld only do behind closed doors. He spins around, throwing his arms out and stopping ddead tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA and MOM are standing in his doorway.  Mom looks horr Lisa represses a giggle. Mom reaches over and knocks timidly on the open door. Jesse hastily pulls the pencils out of his nose and dives stereo to turn it off.  Beet-red, he tosses the hat and s glasses onto the bed and tries to look nonchalant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks to Mom who takes the hint and turns to leave. takes a step into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (when Mom is out of range) I told her you invited me over.  I guess I should have called, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the embarrassment, he's glad to see her.  He puts pencils in the desk drawer and shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay.  I was just...unpacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa casually steps over to a carton and peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you might like some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasantly surprised) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JESSE'S ROOM
dialogues.text: The room is shaping up nicely with only a few boxes remai Jesse pulls a bundle wrapped in newspapers from a carton. tears away the paper, revealing a baseball trophy. He places it on a conspicuous corner of his dresser. Lisa reaches into the box, retrieves an aerosol can and l it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CAN
dialogues.text: A medicated spray for JOCK ITCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does this go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE grabs the can from her hand and puts it down on the behind the trophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mortified) There's a box of sweaters over there  if you want to put them up in the  closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is anxious to pitch in.  She nods good-naturedly and over to her assignment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lisa opens the door and pulls an overhead chain to swi the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she drags a chair over, lifts a pile of sweaters from box, steps up on the chair and stacks them on a shelf.  S to step back down when something catches her attention in back corner of the shelf. She reaches in and pulls out a small, red leatherbound bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps over to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOOK
dialogues.text: about two-thirds the size of an average paperback, it has matching leather thong that snaps into a small latch on t and opens the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "Nancy Thompson, 1428 Elm..." (looking up at him) Hey, this thing is five years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse steps over and looks over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Uh-uh.  Before my time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns a few pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "February 17th - My birtday.  Daddy          came by today with a big ol' stuffed  bear for me.  He took me to dinner  and a movie and when we got back, he  and Mother had another one of their  fights.  He left angry.  I wish they would stop fighting..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse waves the diary away, uninterested.  He crosses bac continue unpacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's sad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cynically) Traumas of a ten-year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa leafs through a few more pages, stops and begins rea widening eyes.  She glances at Jesse and smiles impishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "March 7th - Glen asked me to sleep  with him again.  I can't yet - I  like him, I want to make him happy  but I'm not sure that I love him.   I can't sleep with someone I don't  love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's typical.  I hope she didn't expect to make the best seller list  with this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa ignores him and scans the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding something) Wow, listen to this! (reading) "Sometimes, when I'm lying here in  bed, I can see Glen, in his window across the way, getting ready for bed.  His body is slim and smooth and I know I shouldn't watch but that part of me that wants him forces me to.  That's when I weaken.  That's when I want to go to him..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is suddenly interested.  He walks over and Lisa han the diary with the page open to that entry. He reads it and quickly turns the page.  He frowns and tu another, then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? (another couple of pages) Wait, she skipped a week. (reading) "March 15 - he comes to me at night. Horrible.  Ugly.  Dirty.  Under the sheets with me, tearing at my night- gown with his steel claw..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's voice trails off on "claw" and a chill of vague  recognition goes through him.  He checks the cover of te flips back a few pages. Lisa moves closer to read over his shoulder. Jesse composes himself and looks back at the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "His name is Fred and he keeps taking me to the boiler room.  He wants to kill me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse almost shivers.  He turns the page, and he freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DIARY
dialogues.text: Jesse shows her the page.  There is one sentence scrawled the next entry.  Lisa reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tina is dead."

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE AND LISA
dialogues.text: They look at each other, spooked.  He turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "Rod's been killed - he got Rod. Just Glen and me now.  Can't fall asleep!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's face turns ashen as he looks up at Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding; covering) Something Grady told me today about the people that lived here last.  Girl went crazy - saw her boyfriend killed in the house across the  street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is interrupted by Mom, poking her head into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse instinctively hides the diary behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over the room, impressed at the progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks great!  Thought you might want to take a break - got some cold cider downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks at Lisa to see what she wants to do. Lisa looks over at Jese's alarm clock.  THe time is 8 P.M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up) No...thanks.  I better get back. (to Jesse) Got a major paper due the end of this week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ducking back out) Well, it's there if you change your  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse waits for her to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods sourly) World History. (brightening) But, I'll see you in the morning, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the diary) Hot stuff.  Let me know how it turns out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse opens the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll walk you downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM wraps the night-cover over the BIRD CAGE.  She steps ANGELA on the couch and crosses in front of DAD, in his r vegetating in front of the tube.  SHe sits and loosens he a bit.

dialogues.speaker: ON DAD
dialogues.text: He shifts uncomfortably and wipes some beaded sweat from lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dad) A little warm in here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad gets up from his chair.  His shirt is sticky with  perspiration. Jesse steps in from the dining room, a glass of milk in h

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: looking up at Jesse.  She puts a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh...The birds are sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse notices the intense heat in the room immediately. widen portentiously.

dialogues.speaker: ON DAD
dialogues.text: at the thermostat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astounded) It's 97 degrees in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls off the coverplate and starts fiddling with the Suddenly, a LOUD SQUAWK from the other side of the room m everyone look up. Jesse puts his milk down on he T.V. and hurries over to t ripping the cover away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BIRD CAGE
dialogues.text: Another series of HORRIBLE CRIES as one of the budgies pr rip up the neck of the other one with his sharp beak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse throws open the door and tries to pull the attackin off his victim.  the vicious one continues the rabid atta Jesse's hand, drawing blood. As Jesse pulls his arm out, the bird flies out into the l room, roaring a repetitive WAR-CRY that is eerie and unna something that size. MOM and DAD jump to their feet.  ANGELA starts screaming top of her lungs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BIRD
dialogues.text: It circles around the ceiling and then DIVES for Dad, cut deep gash under his eye.  It seems much larger than it wa - maybe twice its original size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Get a broom or something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom dashes out of the room. THE BIRD swoops down, heading for Angela but crashing int shade of a table lamp, knocking it to the floor. It flutters to the ceiling and hovers near a light fixtur beak and most of its head is covered in blood and it open mouth to emit a gutteral growl. MOM returns with a broom and hands it to Dad. As Dad approaches and lifts the broom to his shoulder, th screams agai and dives for Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse throws his arm out to block the attack.  The bird r direction and Dad swings in mid-air with the broom. He misses, demolishing the remaining table lamp instead.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BIRD
dialogues.text: It hovers again in the air, seemingly without any means o support, PUFFING UP, GROWING ANGRIER, MORE DEMONIC.  Then it seems ready for a last lethal attack, there is a loud the bird literally EXPLODES into FLAMES in mid-air. The family looks at one another in horror and disbelief. sound in the room is ANGELA, attached to her mother's leg whimpering quietly.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: DAD         dumps an odd assortment of home handyan tools table.  He picks through them, selecting a pipe wrench an driver. He crosses to the stove.  We see Mom in the B.G., standin quite cowering, still in shock from the bird attack. Jesse is leaning on the counter, next to the range, watch father's determined moves. Dad leans into the appliance and attempts to pull it away wall, probably tearing six or seven ligaments in the proc After several tries, he stops and looks up at his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me with this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the gas, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) Don't tell me it's not the gas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks on the stove with more vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me it's not the gas!  Your mother thought she smelled gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (timidly) I wasn't sure, Ken...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mom) Alright then, what is it?  Bird rabies? That cheap seed you've been buying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resenting that) Oh, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it then?  There's got to be an explanation.  Animals just don't burst into flames for no reason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it sure isn't leaky gas pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad stands up suddenly, CRACKING his head on the edge of hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Ken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he groans in pain, he's suddenly hit with a revelation points an accusatory finger at Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set this all up, didn't you?  One of your sick jokes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I'm talking about.  What did you use, a fire cracker?  A cherry bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is angry now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to listen to this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Ken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad looks blankly at the wrench in his trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...I don't know, Shirl. He used to be a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark again, sleeping soundly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse emerges from his room and eases the door shut as qu possible.  He stops to listen for any signs of his parent awake.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND OVER
dialogues.text: He steps lightly past their room adn toward the head of t stairs. WE FOLLOW Jesse as he descends the stairs into the darken

dialogues.speaker: THE CELLAR DOOR
dialogues.text: Jesse stops there, momentarily losing his nerve. He finally turns the knob and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pulls an overhead chain, flooding the cellar with l It's just as he saw it in his dream but devoid of any int he steps up the the furnace, squats down and opens the fi door.  He reaches in.  To his horror, he feels something out an object, wrapped in rags.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OBJECT
dialogues.text: as he unwraps it.  An old, beat leather glove with a row knife blades protruding from the fingers. Suddenly, the furnace switches on with a ROAR. FLAMES are leaping out of the firebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughingly) Hot enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE reels around. FREDDY is just across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the glove) Go ahead, Jesse.  Try it on for size!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks at the glove.  The blades are no longer ruste gleaming and sharp. he throws the weapon to the floor.  Freddy moves in close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to finish my work.  Let me teach you, Jesse.  We'll have fun.   You like my little trick with the  bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy advances.  Jesse steps behind a stack of cartons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill for me. (laughing) c'mon Jesse.  Come to Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pushes over a stack of cartons in his path and dive steps. Halfway up he misses his footing and slips, tumbling back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jesse comes to at the foot of the cellar steps.  The f has stopped and Freddy is gone.  As he gets to his feet, notices.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOVE
dialogues.text: on te floor, where he dropped it as shiny and new as the was made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM, DAD, and ANGELA are all at the breakfast table, pick their food; none of them is particularly hungry this morn JESSE enters and heads wordlessly to a coffee pot on the he pours himself a cup and turns abound to face his famil Jesse and Dad are making an extra effort to avoid each ot contact.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: She's still feeling bad, drawing little circles in a pudd maple syrup with a corner of her waffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dad, suddenly) Why did it take them five years to sell this house, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad shrugs his shoulders uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  COuldn't get the right price, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't know anything about a  murder across the street and a  crazy girl who lived here - who  saw the whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom looks at Dad.  This is all news to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testily) I don't know. (a beat, coming clean) They told me something about it, yeah. What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels Mom's stare and finally turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Shirl, how'd you think we got such a good deal? (to Jesse) Listen - all old houses have stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they tell you she went totally  out of her mind - that they had to put her away?  And that her mother killed herself in our living room?

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: She slides up to Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comforting her) Shhhhh.  Jesse and Daddy are just making believe, sweetheart. (to Jesse) I don't think we should be talking about this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad turns back to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Angela) You see what you're doing?  Now I don't want to hear another word about it.  There's nothing wrong  with this house!

dialogues.speaker: ON MOM
dialogues.text: he looks up from Angela and sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something burning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad oth look toward the counter-top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLOWING RED-HOT and then, not just smokey toast but FLAME out of the bread slots. Mom gasps and Dad jumps to his feet, grabs a dish-towel a beating out the fire. JESSE turns white as he watches the scene. Dad turns white as he watches the scene. DAD turns away from the smoldering toaster, tosses the to and heads back toward the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craziest damn thing I ever saw - wasn't even plugged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse puts his cut down hard on the counter and walks out screen door slams behind him. Mom looks at Dad, horrified as Anglea clings to ehr side.

dialogues.speaker: IN JESSE'S CAR
dialogues.text: As JESSE unrolls the bundle of rags he found the night be lets the finger knives drop with a CLATTER on the seat be himself and LISA. On Lisa's side of the dashboard we see the remnants of a fast-food breakfast;  Egg McMuffin, danish, orange juice coffee.  Jesse nurses a cup of joe as Lisa picks up the g examines it with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is amazing!  Your dream told you where this was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Only it was more like, you know, sleep- walking.  All I know is I woke up on the cellar floor next to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his knapsack and pulls out the diary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about going back to sleep after that.  I was up all night. (more intense) I finished reading this.  It gets real crazy towards the end, after all the death stuff.  But then she said some- thing really freaky - about her mother taking her down to the basement to  show her the glove.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: She's totally sucked in to the story, wide-eyes and waiti more.  She offers a french fry to Jesse.  He shakes his h pops it into her mouth and nods for Jesse to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when she started talking about Fred Krueger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Krueger.  The guy in her dream  who's coming to kill her.  Seems he  was a real guy, ten years before who went around kidnapping kids and  killing them.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: She emits a long, windy whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIDS are at their lockers, taking off their jackets and g together everything they'll need for the day.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE AND LISA
dialogues.text: As they walk down the hall together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you were having a premonition or something.  You know, like those guys who help the police solve crimes and  find missing people.  You ever had  anything like this happen before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) No. Never. (a beat) You think that's what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop in the middle of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I look at that diary for a little while?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse raises his eyebrows vaguely, reaches in his bag and over the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can go on, they are interrupted by a squeaky v their side.  At the sound of it, Lisa displays annoyed  recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) I got your invitation yesterday.   Thanks. (a beat) Any cute guys gonna be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tired sigh) All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yor dad picking the music again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Mom's trying to keep him upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks at Lisa quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) Last party I had, Dad insisted on  playing nothing but Benny Goodman records all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class bell RINGS. Lisa leans over and kisses Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kiss takes him by surprise as she walks off with Kerr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) I may be late.  Baseball practice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school TEAM has been split up into two sides.  There' of excitement about - like it's a close game, drawing to GRADY is on third, waiting to be hit home. The PITCHER winds and throws.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BATTER
dialogues.text: A swing and a miss.  SCHNEIDER calls him out. He tosses the bat aside, disgustedly. JESSE is on deck.  As he approaches the plate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last out.  Up to you, Walsh.

dialogues.speaker: ON GRADY
dialogues.text: He sneers like they might as well just concede the game n home early. The PITCHER sends one right down the middle. JESSE lets it go and Schneider calls a strike. He chokes up a bit on the bat and takes his stance. Another perfect pitch and Jesse lets it go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady slaps himself in the face and shakes his head pitif The PITCHER throws another. This time, Jese catches it perfectly, SLAMMING it down th for a solid hit. GRADY scores amid cheers and slaps on the back.  JESSE ho first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE is at the end of a row of lockers.  He pulls off hi and tosses it in the locker, takes down a towel and sets on the bench next to him. Several BOYS pass by on their way to their lockers or the giving Jesse the thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good game, Walsh...Way to go, Walsh ...etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRADY approaches and goes to his own locker, down a few f Jesse's. Jesse plops down on the bench and slowly pulls off his sn He stops to rub his aching shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You hit that ball pretty good, Walsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to choke up that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad.  He played in the minors for a while, when he got out of college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue undressing in silence.  As Jesse speaks, CO SCHNEIDER steps up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider shouldn't have called you out on that double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Schneider's got a stick up his ass today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Schneider's always got a stick up his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider smiles wickedly as he places his hands on the t shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE and GRADY trudge along at somewhere between a job a stumble.  They talk to each other with words that are pun by huffs, puffs and side-stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously) You remember your dreams, Grady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the wet ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shoots him a condescending sneer and decides not to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lot is practically empty with most of the students on home by now.  Jesse's car is parked in the center. LISA is leaning on the car, waiting with a stack of books side.  She looks up as Jesse approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Schneider id it to me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got here myself.  Went to the Public Library. (proudly) Cut four classes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door for her.  She picks up the books and cl Jesse runs around to the other side and slides in beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the books) What's all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Research. (she kisses him) Hi. (an intriguing wink) C'mon, let's go for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blue Falcon rolls down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: JESSE is driving as LISA re-stacks some of the books on h and begins leafing through one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm convinced you've had a genuine psychic vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks over at her inquisitively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I wasn't sure because you said that you never had anyting like  last night happen before.  But I  found out that most people have the potential for tuning in to "the  other world" and neve do.  It has something to do with the environment  - like they have to be in a place  that's sending signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a haunted house, right?  I don't believe in ghosts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to.  You just have to believe in energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts in her seat to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intensely) Look, you got electricity in your body, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know...synapses neurong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And heat and chemical reactions. Where does it all go when you die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - into the air I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing up ahead) Make a left at this corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns at the intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about "essential energy" the  soul.  Does that go into the air too?  You think there's a good  energy and a bab energy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confussed) I don't know. (a beat) Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles mysteriously) It's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old generating plant, big enough to have served what w small town but rundown and obsolete now.  the place is ch the grounds are littered with rubble - as if there'd been there long ago. The entrance to the plant is boarded up and plastered wit TRESPASSING" signs.  Many of the boards are missing, prov easy access for the scores of vandals who had torn throug at one time or another. There are no windows at ground level but the top of the b is lined with many multi-paned frames; all of them are ei cracked or missing. JESSE'S CAR pulls into frame and he and LISA get out and place over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excidedly) Remember in the diary - Nancy said that she kept finding herself in  a boiler room?  Fred Krueger worked here.  It's an old power- plant - a steam generator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out several papers and hands them to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PAPERS
dialogues.text: Xeroxes of newspaper articles. The HEADLINE reads:  "SPRINGWOOD SLASHER ARRESTED!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did some reading up on our friend, Fred Krueger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse leafs through the papers.  Each one is a front page local newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sucks in his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Lisa climb between a pair of boards and step in

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: She walks toward the center of the plant, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the remnants of a large boiler room.  Big stee jut out of the floor in a tangle of elbows and valves and clutter of debris.  A one-story holdig tank rises above a pit and is met on top by a mze of catwalks, just under th windows. Although most of the ceiling has burned away, the interio surprisingly intact for a derelict building and the overh distracts form any intrinsic creepiness the place would p after dark. Jesse steps in behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly) He kidnapped twenty kids and brought them all here to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives herself a chill but shakes it off and turns to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you feeling anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might be able to make a connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shrugs his shoulders and puts his hands to the side mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Any ghosts in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Concentrate or some- thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shifts his legs and stares up at the ceiling.  He c eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still concentrating) I feel like a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh.  Just concentrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse walks around in a small circle, keeping hsi head up eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Uh-uh. (a beat) Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks slowly across the room, almost in a trance, unti comes to a board leaning up against the foot of the mesh- stairway that leads up to the catwalks.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOARD
dialogues.text: As his hand reaches over to touch it.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: stepping over next to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the board away. A LARGE RAT, in her nest, WITH HER YOUNG, SNARLS at him. Jesse and Lisa jump into each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE and LISA walk along the outskirts of the building t pretty cluster of shade trees nearby.  Lisa hoists hersel boulder and looks at the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About not finding any bogey men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'll get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is disappointed - She wanted to find some bogey men. Jesse comes up close to her and they stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You are sensitive.  I mean you sensed that the rat was there.  And I can feel something about you.  Sometimes I feel like I know what you're thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse moves in closer an puts his arms on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suggestively) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the  suggestion) Maybe it only happens when you're sleeping - that's the way it was with Nancy, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, there's an idea we can take off  on.  Maybe we should drive out to the beach tonight and lay out a couple of blankets and... (winks) Until I fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slyly) Maybe we can do that.  Strictly  scientific, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse moves in until their lips are almost touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nancy went bonkers from this thing. You wouldn't be afraid of being out on the beach with a potential  lunatic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghostbusters are fearless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.  Not little friendly pecks like before -- this real thing.  Jesse drops his arms to her waist and she op legs so that he can get in real close. Suddenly, Jesse groans in pain and stands upright, tearin their embrace.  For the briefest instant, we can see prot grow and subside on his forehead and the side of his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it - What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his stomach) Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - a sharp pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa watches his helplessly.  Finally, the agony lifts fr Jesse's face.  He straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, this is no good.  You've got to get some sleep, Jesse.  You've  got to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is in bed, tossing restlessly adn panting heavily. drenched with sweat and continues to perspire profusely a up and turns on his bedside lamp. A thunderhead is RUMBLING somewhere nearby. The PLASTIC SHADE OF THE LAMP is melting. He scans the room picking out various indications of the heat that is surrounding him; A CANDLE on his bookshelf c into a puddle of wax, the LAMINATED TOP OF THE NIGHT-TABL bubbling, an UNSHEATHED RECORD ALBUM hangs over the corne desk, his PORTABLE STEREO has caved in the center - a Dal tableau.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND OVER
dialogues.text: Jesse gets out of bed, crossing to the desk.  The scrapin intensifes.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWER
dialogues.text: as Jesse opens it.  Inside, THE GLOVE, fingers moving,  independently, unattached, scraping little cuts in the bo the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: slamming the drawer shut.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: JESSE, barefoot and wearing only a pair of jeans and an u shirt, steps up to the door to Angela's room.  The sound from inside.  He opens the door. ANGELA is standing in the middle of the floor, in her nig seemingly oblivious to the heat.  She is jumping rope and chanting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, two, Freddy's coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, four, better lock your door.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANGELA
dialogues.text: She sees her brother staring at her.  She doesn't stop ju smiles and continues her jingle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five, six, grab your crucifix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse SLAMS the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Jesse enters, looks out the windows.  A huge bolt of LIGH RIPS through the night sky; a multiple flash f blue light through the kitchen followed by a CRACK of intense THUNDE ANOTHER FLASH OF LIGHTNING cuts across the kitchen itself SHATTERING SOME DISHES on the counter-top, leaving a plum BLACK SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain continues to come down in buckets.  Jesse enters walks, unprotected in his drenched jeans and shirt and se without any knowledge of where he is going. The streets are totally empty.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DON'S PLACE
dialogues.text: A seedy tavern on a badly lit corner. JESSE steps into frame. He stares at the place before stepping up to he door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. DON'S PLACE
dialogues.text: The toughest looking bar in the entire city.  The place i with PROSTITUTES, PIMPS, TRAVELING SALESMEN, a couple of  TRANSVESTITES and a generous delegation of the leather an contingency. Jesse enters and crosses to the bar amid a few stares.  H a stool. The bartender draws a cold beer and presents it to Jesse. bartender turns away, Jesse reaches for the glass. A HAND slaps down on his wrist and holds it tightly. He looks up. COACH SCHNEIDER is standing over him.  He's wearing a mus shirt, a gold chain around his neck and he has a sick gri face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE is barefoot, jogging arund the outer edge of the gy and looking as if he's about to collapse from exhaustion.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCHNEIDER
dialogues.text: Leaning against a wall of the gym, watching Jesse run. As Jesse comes around for another lap, Schneider reaches grabs him, throwing him into a wall of folding wooden ble Jesse is dazed, ready to drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barking) Hit the showers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns on one of the faucets and lets the hot water full on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCNEIDER turns to a huge, padlocked cabinet on the wall. He unlocks it and opens the doors.  It is filled with a v athletic equipment:  dumbbells, jump-ropes and volley bal Schneider selects a pair of jump-ropes from the cabinet a them down on his desk. A distinct PING makes him look up.  He goes to the door a out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: Jesse continues showering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schneider turns back to his office.  There is ANOTHER PIN A TENNIS RACQUET hanging on the wall has two broken strin MORE STRINGS SMOKE, THEN SNAP with a ping. A BASKETBALL leaps off a shelf of the equipmnt cabinet an on the floor at Schneider's feet. Schneider bends down to pick it up and TWO MORE BALLS jum onto the floor. A FOURTH BALL flies out and knocks over a TROPHY on his d Schneider hits the deck when a DUMBBELL streaks across th and SLAMS into the window, cracking the thick wired glass

dialogues.speaker: ON SCHNEIDER
dialogues.text: he makes his way to the cabinet by crawling along the flo BASKETBALLS, VOLLEYBALLS, even a MEDICINE BALL fly over h He reaches up to close the cabinet doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JUMP-ROPE on the desk unravels like a harpoon line and end of itself around Schneider's wrist.  The other end pu and yanks Schneider off balance. He reaches up to close the cabinet doors.
