dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JUMP-ROPE on the desk unravels like a harpoon line and end of itself around Schneider's wrist.  The other end pu and yanks Schneider off balance. As he reaches with his free arm to unwrap his wrist, the ROPE rockets off the desk top and secures itself to his o wrist. hThe office door opens by itself.  The ropes drag Schneid screaming from the room.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: JESSE turns as the shower head next to the one he is usin gurgles and suddenly comes on full.  And suddenly, all th are on, spewing water and steam. We hear Schneider's screams as he is dragged into the roo through great puddles of water and against the tiled wall Jesse.  The showers on this side are OFF. The boy watches in horror as the ropes shoot up to two ad shower nozzles and hoist the Coach into a helpless spread facing the wall.  His clothes shear from his body like sh tissue paper.

dialogues.speaker: A STACK OF TOWELS
dialogues.text: Comes to life, snapping in mid-air at Schneider's butt an As they hit him, they draw blood.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: as the room fills with great clouds of steam until he is obscured; just a dark human form in the corner of the sho

dialogues.speaker: SCHNEIDER
dialogues.text: as a figure in a green and red sweater and a battered fed through the clouds, CACKLING and throwing his weapon-arm a World Series pitcher about to lob a fast ball. Schneider screams painfully as the knives cut four long t him, starting at the top of his naked back, cutting throu flesh. The weapon arm STRIKES AGAIN.  Schneider screams, goes li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD begins to flow out of all the shower heads on Schne side.  Schneider hangs limply from the shower heads.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MURDERER
dialogues.text: CAMERA DOLLIES IN FAST to reveal it is JESSE.  He screams Jesse lifts his hand into frame.  He is wearing Freddy's glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Oh God, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly drops to his knees, sloshing in a crimson puddl stares up to the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the DOORBELL RINGING repeatedly until the lights and DAD hurries to the door, wrapping a robe over his paj

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO POLICEMEN in rain slickers stand on either side of Je is naked but is wrapped in a blanket.  His hair is soaked dripping over his face. This belong to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad can't believe what he's looking at.  He just nods his The 2nd Policeman gives Jesse a slight push across the th He stumbles into the house. We found him wandering out on the Highway,  naked.  Keep a leash on him, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: MOM takes the kettle from the stove and pours it into a m steeps the teabag as she crosses to the table and

dialogues.speaker: JESSE
dialogues.text: Wide awake, holding the blanket tightly around his neck, cup from his mother. DAD paces the floor angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're gonna put our cards on the table, here and now.  There's not going to be any retribution - no fire and  brimstone.  I only have two questions and you'll answer them and we'll all go to bed, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse nods weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What are you taking and who are you getting it from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse snorts and shakes his head ironically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking drugs, Dad. (to Mom) Can I go to bed now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his cheek tenderly) Sure...go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad tries to burn a hole through him with his eyes as Jes up from the table and leaves the room. As the double-hinged doors slap clsoed behind him, Dad tu Mom without a change of expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no question about it) He's on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD is standing on a ladder, unbolting a set of security the windows. He watches from above as JESSE runs out the door, followe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse, please, let's talk about this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleading) I'm okay.  Just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse walks over to his car and climbs in. Mom turns to Dad who is watching the scene curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs professional help.  I think we should take him to a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed) Are you nuts or something?  What the hell is that going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!  I just know he needs help and we don't know how to give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad shifts on the ladder and begins to protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squelching it) Don't fight me on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stomps back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) He needs a kick in the but, is what he needs.  He needs a methodone  clinic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws back a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, blow it out your ass, Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Dad loses his footing on the ladder and drops several rungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's car travels slowly and turns onto a tree-lined st

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: JESSE drives silently with LISA looking over at him, upse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Will you stop and tell me what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring straight ahead) I'm fine.  Nothing's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (undeterred) you didn't say more than two words to me the whole way here.  You had another nightmare, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yeah, I had a bad night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Dad thinks I'm on drugs, my Mom thinks I'm crazy and I'm not sure I don't agree with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jesse's car pulls into the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they turn a corner.  Jesse jams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: THE GYMNASIUM WING
dialogues.text: in the distance.  A crowd of STUDENTS is gathered in a ri three-deep outside the doors leading to the practice fiel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open the door, jumps out and runs toward the cr Bewildered, Lisa does likewise, running after him. As they get closer, they can see that the entire area is of with red plastic ribbons. SEVERAL POLICEMEN and OFFICIALS are coming in and out of building. A TEACHER is trying to disperse the students, clapping hi together and pushing through the rubber-neckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay gang, let's move along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse stops at the edge of the barricade cranes his neck what's going on. GRADY spots Jesse and runs over to his side.  Jesse is tu white as he watches the scene and listens to Grady's reca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, man.  Where have you been? Fuckin' Schneider got wasted last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse swallows hard to regain his composure.  Lisa arrive side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.  I'm gonna be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores him) He must've been working late and some fruitcake came in and sliced him up like a kielbasa.  In the shower!  Left bloody footprints all over the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse clamps his hand over his mouth and breaks for some against the building. Grady looks at a horrified Lisa and gives a puzzled shrug

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FOOD LINE
dialogues.text: LISA and KERRY are on the lunch line, sliding their trays the rails.  Kerry is wearing a walkman with the volume tr up - we can almost make out the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was something this morning, huh? About Schneider, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa nods and takes a plate of macaroni and cheese from o KITCHEN STAFF.  She doesn't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sure took it bad, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa shrugs and moves her tray away from Kerry's, toward CASHIER. Kerry picks up a piece of cake from a shelf and slides eh down until she's next to Lisa again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: JESSE is sitting at a table, a tray of food in front of h untouched. He glances up at GRADY as he sits down next to him and st digging in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with his mouth full) Look, I'm sorry about Schneider, man. I didn't know you were so close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse doesn't qualify that with a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go out to a movie or something tonight?  Get your mind off things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse shakes his head. Lisa comes over to the table with her tray and sits down Jesse. Kerry follows and sits next to Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys. (to Grady,  coquettishly) Hi, Ronny.  You going to Lisa's party tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up from his food) I can't.  I'm grounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For throwin' my grandmother down a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerry, taking him seriously, nods gravely. Lisa looks at Jesse's tray of untouched food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jesse) You should eat something - you'll feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd talk to me.  We can figure it out, you know.  We can figure it out together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to figure out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa, disgustedly) You're wasting your time, the guy's a basket case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady pushes his tray aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to shut up?  Fine, I'll  shut up, that's fine.  See you around, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady gets up and storms away from the table. Lisa, deeply pained, looks at Jesse.  Jesse avoids her st he just drops his head into his hands and tries not to cr front of his friends. He composes himself quickly and digs his fork into his lu choking down some macaroni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA, her MOTHER and FATHER are sitting, eating dinner. mind is not at the table with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) Bought some nice strawberries at the  farm today.  We can have some short cake for your friends tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks up an dsmiles blandly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also wangled a promise out of your father.

dialogues.speaker: ON MR. POLETTI
dialogues.text: He scowls slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (politely) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna stay out of your way tomorrow night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.  The lights inside are all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear FOOTSTEPS and we TRAVEL with the sound along the the foot of the basement steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he climbs the steps and approaches the door to the mai the house. THE CAMERA is moving faster now, leaping the top steps an CRASHING through the doorway and onto the foyer floor. It crosses the FOYER adn begins climbing the stairs to th level.  It stops at Angela's room and opens the door. ANGELA sleeps soundly, peacefully. It crosses over to the bed, a menacing SHADOW creeps over form.  The taloned glove pulls down on the blankets and s position in the center of the bed, innocent and vulnerabl We see the SHADOW of the intruder on the wall...it moves to the sleeping child and emits a guttural, inhuman VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, little girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes flutter open.  She looks up at the intruder and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily) What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see that it's JESSE standing over her.  he's in hi underpants, drenched with sweat and hunched over as if al muscles in his body were twisted around each other. The sound of Angela's voice softens him.  He slowly strag and looks about the room as if wondering how he got there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (himself again) It's late...go back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and closes her eyes. Jesse starts to pull the covers back over her and stops s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His right hand is wearing the GLOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk lamp and a late movie on the T.V. are the only s light in the room. We see that the bed is rumpled and empty and we PAN acros room, to JESSE, sitting on the floor in front of the door up against his chest, trying with all his strength to sta He has a mug of black coffee in his hand and a pot of jav side. He tops off his cup and reaches into the breast pocket of shirt, withdrawing a small vial of pills.

dialogues.speaker: A BOTTLE OF NO-DOZ
dialogues.text: He rips the cap off with his teeth and dumps half the bot his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, dreary day.  There are no morning sounds except f SQUEAKING of an old rattle-trap bicycle as an overweight swings by and lobs the morning edition over the lawn. The paper skids off the front steps and into the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE walks down the steps.  He looks ragged and exhauste worse that ever.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: He stops before going through the double-hinged door to p hair back and forces a well rested, easy-going guise.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: DAD and ANGELA are sitting at the table.  MOM is pouring coffee into a couple of cups. JESSE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you sleep, honey, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom gives him a quick glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking a little better today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD looks at Jesse's pale skin, the light stubble on his his dark, bloodshot eyes and turns to Mom as if she's nut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire pool area has been done up to the max.  Japane lanterns have been strung up above the fence, a long tabl covered with festively arranged salads and condiments, st across the patio in front of the sliders and a Benny Good tune is blaring through some outdoor speakers.  An all-to underwater light makes the blue water shimmer crystal-cle A score of nubile GIRLS in scanty swimsuits and athletic cut-offs and trunks, scamper around, eating, swimming and around.

dialogues.speaker: ON MR. POLETTI
dialogues.text: Standing over the gas grill, wearing a "Kiss the Cook" ch and apron, cooking up a mess of hanburgers and hot dogs.

dialogues.speaker: ON MRS. POLETTI AND LISA
dialogues.text: stepping out of the house through the sliders, carrying m plates of food outside.

dialogues.speaker: A BOY
dialogues.text: bounces once on the diving board and CANNONBALLS into the of the pool, SPLASHING everything within a fifteen foot r including,

dialogues.speaker: MR. POLETTI
dialogues.text: who spins around from the grill, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA turns to her mother, mortified. Mrs. Poletti hands her the platter she is holding and giv reassuring squeeze on the shoulder before leaving her sid crossing toward her husband. Lisa turns her attention to JESSE, at the far corner of t sitting in a lounger, alone.  He looks worried and detach She looks back toward the grill. MRS. POLETTI is pulling her husband away, against his wil finally relents and beckons a BOY over.  He turns his spa to him, surrenders his chef's hat and allows Lisa's mom t him back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally gets up and crosses toward the cabanas, going and shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO LISA
dialogues.text: as her mother and father approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going up to bed now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gratefully) Thanks, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Poletti clearly doesn't like this arrangement.  He lo behind him at all the horny young boys and turns back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) Twelve-thiry, Miss.  No later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods agreeably) Twelve-thirty.  I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Poletti takes her husband by the arm again and leads to the sliders.  He turns around before going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't forget to lock the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Goodnight, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Poletti is half-led, half-pushed through the doorway. Poletti pulls the slider closed behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roomy dressing area with an open shower stall at the ba There's a wide, wooden bench along one wall, covered with and towels. JESSE stands in the center of the room, putting his pants is shirtless and shoeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse hesitates, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa waits for Jesse.  Finally, he unlatches the door.  h is on, unbuttoned.  Lisa steps into the cabana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa shuts the door behind her.  The two look at each oth moment.  Then Jesse looks away and continues buttoning hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I better go.  I'm just not into it tonight.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you leave me alone?  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse crosses to the bench and sits to put on his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not being fair to me.  I'm  worried about you and I want to  help you get through this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?  How are you  gonna help?  I'm losing my mind. (breaking down) I don't want to have you watch me fall apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa goes to Jesse.  She puts a comforting arm on his sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse takes her hand and holds it tight.  She sits beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked) I'm afraid to go to sleep, I'm afraid to  stay awake - I'm ruining your party.  They're gonna put me away for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll figure it out together.  We'll  stay up all night if we have to.  I won't let anything happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into each others eyes.  Lisa kisses him ever so then again.  he kisses her.  Their kisses grow hungrier. Love conquers fear and they embrace fully, kissing passio

dialogues.speaker: POOLSIDE
dialogues.text: THREE BOYS are huddled together, looking up at the Polett bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any second, now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights FLICK OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Party time.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE WET BAR
dialogues.text: Someone reaches over to the stereo, pops out the Benny Go cassette and flicks the radio on.  Van Halen BLASTS out o speakers.

dialogues.speaker: ON KERRY
dialogues.text: In the pool, up to her neck with a HUNK.  They both look music changes.  The top of her bathing suit floats up to surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wow, Van Halen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of the music, Mr. Poletti sits up in bed, an Mrs. Poletti puts an arm on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Let them have their fun, Honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. poletti pulls out a pair of earplugs and hands them Poletti, who grumbles, sticks them in his ear and drops b into his pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody switches off the lights to general applause.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO KERRY AND THE HUNK
dialogues.text: They are in a steamy embrace when the underwater lights g The rest of her suit pops up out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON SOME BUSHES
dialogues.text: as a COUPLE pulls out a red wagon, stashed in the shrubbe loaded with beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSE and LISA rolling around on the floor, a lot of heav petting; not doing it but serious, heated stuff just the HIS HAND, wrapped around Lisa's wrist, pinning it gently floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: Her eyes closed; feeling him - definitely feeling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is about to take down Lisa's swimsuit top when an u long iridescent serpent-like TONGUE flicks a foot out of mouth, wiggles and flicks back in. Jesse moans lasciviously, not his own voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse pushes himself away from Lisa and scrambles to his Lisa, unaware of what happened, is puzzled and upset.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: sitting up on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse tucks in his shirt and buttons his pants.  he is vi shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa just looks at him, helplessly. He slips out the cabana door and shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: she gets up slowly.  She's profoundly worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady is sleeping on his back, dead to the world. Suddenly, a hand clamps down over his mouth. A light flicks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's JESSE.  A window is open in the B.G., teh curtains i disarray. He lifts his hand from Grady's mouth and Grady scrambles bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely) Jesus Christ, you scared the shit out of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta let me stay here tonight, Grady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nuts or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Grady, this is serious. Something really weird is happening.  It started out like just bad dreams but it's getting real bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady is tired and cranky and he doesn't want ot hear thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, will you get out of here!  Go and take a sleeping pill or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flops back down on his bed and puts his arm over his e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, take a whole bottle and do the  world a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed Schneider, Grady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady lifts his arm from his eyes and stares at Jesse  preposterously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Only it wasn't me - I was there but it was like something inside of me, moving me around.  Then last night  it made me go into my sister's room  and tonight, with Lisa in the cabana.  We were...on the floor - I felt it happening again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Grady's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wanted me to kill them, Grady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady continues his dumbfounded stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You're fucked in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared, Grady.  I know it sounds crazy.  But, there's something trying  to get into my body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneers) The only thing trying to get into your body is female and waiting for you on a cabana floor.  And you want to sleep with me.  Go figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't care if you believe me or not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.  You had some scary dreams, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) No! (shakes his head) I don't know - everything's all mixed up. (suddenly angry) What difference does it make?  I'm in trouble here.  I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady lets that sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softer) Okay, schmuck.  What do you want me  to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch me.  If anything weird  happens - like if I start dreaming  weird or try to walk out of here,  you gotta try to bring me out of it.  his me over the head if you have to. Just don't let me leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady looks down at the floor, sighs, and nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Grady...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fall asleep!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The underwater lights are still off, the music has calmed bit and most of the KIDS are more into necking than swimm TWO BODIES are rolled up in a blanket together.  From a s SQUEAL, we can deduce that it's KERRY and her HUNK. The BAR-B-QUE BOY has remained steadfast at his post alth GIRLFRIEND has joined him and he's paying more attention than the hotdogs on the grill.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: She sitting on one of the lounges, her eyes are red from She's being comforted by a girlfriend, PATTY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearfully) He won't talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not doing him or yourself any good sitting here and worrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks at her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoud go see him, but...I don't know, the party and all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (encouragingly) Go ahead.  I'll hold down the fort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up) Thanks, Patty.  You're a pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady is sitting up in bed, staring at the T.V.  He turns JESSE, slumped in a nearby chair, asleep. Grady switches off the TV with the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady turns off the READING LIGHT by the bed.  He gives a look at Jesse before he pushes the whole thing out of his with a disgusted wave of his arm and lays back down.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, his eyes open widely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady MUMBLES an obscenity and turns over on his side to Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's happening again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grady turns the reading light back on in time to see Jess OVER and curl up in obviously incredible pain, falling to knees.  He flails out as if 1000 volts were going through and begins to choke on his tongue. Grady scrambles out of bed and dances around Jesse, not k what to do.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE'S HAND
dialogues.text: as he raises it and his fingers spread widely apart. Four steel RAZOR-KNIVES tear out from withing the tips of fingers like long, bloody switchblades! The cat looks up at Lisa with ONLY THE TAIL OF THE RAT ST OUT OF ITS MOUTH.  Its eyes are demonic, its teeth crooke fangs.  It growls like a beast five times its size. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA jumps down off the sairway onto the catwalk and star run.  She CLANGS over the steel-mesh flooring. A section of the catwalk gives way beneath her feet and  LISA plummets as if she were dropped through a trap door. arms flail over her head, but her hand manages to grab ar section of handrail that's still solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we see the catwalk is intact - it looks as if her knees j out but she continues to hold on to the railing for dear She tests the flooring by feeling it before attempting to release her grip. She rises and turns around. FREDDY is there. Lisa SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had your chance. (raising his talons) Die now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slashes at her.  She ducks and runs back toward the st The STAIRWAY IS RED HOT, SMOKING. FREDDY closes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to me, Lisa - I'm waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa stops short, looks around desperately.  There is now go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, Jesse - I know you're there! Stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's dead, Lisa.  Freddy's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy strikes, cutting Lisa's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy closes in on her.  She is trapped, finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles perversely) Wanna join your little friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Jesse.  I'm Jesse now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him back.  Jesse, talk to me. Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy raises his talons for the kill.  The sharp oints a an inch of her eyes.  Lisa, terrified, summons up all her all her might, and looks Freddy in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jesse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy stares at ehr, talons frozen in mid-air.  The horr quivers, as if against an unseen force.  And then -- The wounds on Freddy's shoulder and chest rip open. He looks down at them, surprised.  They bleed real, human

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa breaks past him and starts to run but stops suddenly paces from Freddy.  She turns to look at him leaning weak against the railing, with an expression of confusion on h that is almost pathetic.  he touches his wounds, surprise Lisa is no longer afraid - she's angry now.  She looks hi straight in the eye. His razor-knives click together like they're running low batteries. Freddy beckons her over with the knife on his index finge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Jesse's voice)         Come and get me, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy laughs wickedly. LISA moves a step toward Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of you.  You couldn't kill me...He's in there and I want him back.  I'm gonna take him away from you and you're going straight  back to hell, you son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry) Jesse's dead!  I sliced 'im real good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa moves closer to Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back to me, Jesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks her gaze on Freddy's eyes and looks right throu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jesse.  Come back to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead, you bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy seems to be in a good deal of pain.  He drops to o Lisa moves closer.  He tries to move away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threateningly) I'll kill you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) He can't hold you Jesse.  He's losing his grip - you can get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll die with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels beside Freddy, takes off his hat and begins to stroke his head.  he seems to be writhing a bit and emits frightened moans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll die with both of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers all her nerve and moves in closer. He lifts his deadly hand and presses it into her chest. flinches in pain but continues to come in close until her almost touching his. he moves his blades onto her back, trying to push them in flesh, but he is too weak to do much damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked in this strange embrace, she presses her lips agai with as much passion as she can muster and KISSES HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment of quiet.  Then smoke starts to rise of Freddy.  He pushes her away with an excruciating SCREAM. The sound of the POUNDING machinery is becoming deafening electric FLASHES are firing more rapidly and arcing acros Power Plant.  The room is RAPIDLY HEATING UP. A SMALL FLAME shoots along the railing. SMALL FIRES begin to break out on the catwalk around Fred

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PAINT BEGINS TO SMOKE AND BUBBLE with the heat.  As t increases it INTO FLAME.

dialogues.speaker: ON PIPES
dialogues.text: STEAM begins shooting up from every pipe joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEAM shoots out of the valves.  heavy iron VALVE WHEELS THEIR STEMS and roll down the FLAMING CATWALKS.

dialogues.speaker: ON LISA
dialogues.text: Surrounded by flames and smoke, she watches it all with f amazement.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: His flesh is starting to melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bursts into DENSE, ALL-ENGULFING FLAME. The power plant is going crazy:  the steaming, smoking, a flaming all reach their high peak.  Pipes are bursting wi valve wheels flying off. Andthen everything begins to slow down, ease off. The flames are dying down around the charred corpse, and see it is no longer moving. The little fires around him are also dying down. And the smoke, the steam, and the deafening noise abate.

dialogues.speaker: ON FREDDY'S CORPSE
dialogues.text: The fires are out now.  there is only some smoke.  And th terrible heat has turned to COOL BLUE LIGHT. The still smoldering corpse, with its back to us, begins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa backs away, terrified.  The corpse turns to her -- i Jesse, his clothes smoldering, his body singed and blacke soot.  But alive, coming around as if it were all just a dream. LISA moves to him and cradles him in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHINY NEW SCHOOL BUS rolls down the street.  It pulls u curb near the Walsh House. JESSE, his RIGHT ARM IN A SLING but otherwise fresh and h kisses MOM goodbye at the FRONT DOOR.  He hurries down to gets in.  The DOORS fold shut, the GEARS GRIND and the bu continues along its route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are about a DOZEN KIDS in the bus, playing radios, good time, etc. LISA, in the back, waves to Jesse and smiles.  She wears on her shoulder where Freddy slashed her.  Jesse, in the smiles and waves back. Jesse makes his way down the aisle to Lisa, greeting a fe slapping a hand or two.

dialogues.speaker: ON JESSE
dialogues.text: Jesse plops down next to her, gives her a quick kiss, put good arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must look like a couple of escapees from a veterans' hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we actually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa puts a finger to her mouth to cut him off -- no need about unpleasant things.  Jesse smiles again -- she's rig kisses her. Jesse moves his head away from hers for the big kiss.  Li are closed, ready to receive it. She opens her eyes.  They are pupil-less, blood-streaked, With an EVIL ROAR, a huge SERPENT TONGUE FLICKS OUT of he and attacks Jesse who screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus WHINES near the top end of third, all of its FLAS firing wildly.  It races away through the desert in a clo dust.
